Package tictactoe

Class Board

java.lang.Object
tictactoe.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class Board extends Object implements Constants
The Board class represents the Tic Tac Toe game board. It provides functionality to set marks, check for winners, display the board, and manage game state.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface tictactoe.Constants

    LETTER_O, LETTER_X, SPACE_CHAR

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructor for the Board class. Initializes the board and sets all spots to SPACE_CHAR.

  • Method Details

    • getMark

      public char getMark(int row, int col)
      Fetches the mark at a given row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index.
      col - The column index.
      Returns:
      The mark at the given row and column.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the board is full.
      Returns:
      true if the board is full, otherwise false.

    • xWins

      public boolean xWins()
      Checks if player 'X' wins.
      Returns:
      true if 'X' wins, otherwise false.

    • oWins

      public boolean oWins()
      Checks if player 'O' wins.
      Returns:
      true if 'O' wins, otherwise false.

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the game board in a formatted manner.

    • addMark

      public void addMark(int row, int col, char mark)
      Adds a mark on the board at a given row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index.
      col - The column index.
      mark - The mark to be placed (either 'X' or 'O').

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the board for a new game.

    • checkWinner

      int checkWinner(char mark)
      Checks if a given mark is a winner.
      Parameters:
      mark - The mark to check (either 'X' or 'O').
      Returns:
      1 if the given mark wins, otherwise 0.

    • displayColumnHeaders

      void displayColumnHeaders()
      Displays the column headers for the board.

      void addHyphens()
      Adds hyphens for board display.
